info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 31 at 10:07AM PST until December 31 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 inches or less inch. North to northwest winds gusting up to 45 mph on the mountain ridges. * WHERE...In California, Modoc County. In Oregon, Central and Eastern Lake County and Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest snow amounts are likely to be in the Warner Mountains. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
